participants: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.message: I'm having some issues with SDLC GitHub integration. When I try to `pull` the latest commit, it fails. Same if I try to setup a new repo from within Instabase, instead of just having it create a new one. (cc @georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire for helping me narrow the issue)
Screengrab of failing to create a repo

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: @Aaron Vontell I think you're the right person to tag- it seems like you cannot set an existing remote and pull in that version.
Similar error for pull:
Hmmm are you trying to pull this into an existing project?

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: The first screenshot is for a new project - not connected yet

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: The second screenshot is when he tries to pull in an older version into an existing project
In the first screenshot, though, there are existing files/folders in the IB workspace.
How big is this project you are trying to pull? Also is that personal access token for your own account, or is that an IB access token?
That's a personal token - the project is pretty small - not bigger than a few MB I'd guess.
~12MB zipped, ~20MB expanded.

So the repo you gave is not in your personal account, so it wouldn’t be able to see it (i.e. it looks at your personal account, looks for a repo called ebc-demo, and doesn’t see it), is what I think is happening
You would want to fork the ebc-demo into your own account and try it then I think

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: How would that work for a customer then? They won't be able to have IB flows in their personal GitHub/GitLabs - can we push/pull for orgs that you belong to?
OK, I will try again - but the second screen shot is a failed pull from my personal account on a repo that I've been able to push updates to successfully.
I believe you can get an access token for an org but I need to double check now…

I don’t think we had that as an initial requirement in the requirements I received, so we may need to revisit this for V2 - I believe V1 is focused on at least getting the capability in so we can begin to test and experiment/iterate on it: https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SALESENG/pages/138936470/SDLC+Prod+Requirements
And we never ended up having the meeting with GS to see how they would be using this (we scheduled it but it got cancelled), so we should really talk to to them
^ not saying this as an excuse :grimacing: if they are using orgs for these, we should setup a call to explore further, because that would be important to have

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: @Aaron Vontell you use your personal access token and then it based it on your permissions to orgs and other user's repos

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: We should add the capability to pull from an orgs repo - actually now that I think of this, it might work but you need to configure your access token that way.

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: You have to check the box for org settings

We would need to add the capability, if it is working that would be great but I would be very confused :joy: the logic currently is “query for the user, list out their repos” - I need to check if org repos are part of that\

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Let me test something!

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: meh just getting errors

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: We should look into expanding this feature though - I'd love to help scope!
That would be great!!
